full_description:
DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Drone

The DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual is ideal for a Business start-up Drone, this versatile quad-copter packs a lot of features that can be utilized across various sectors thanks to an additional set of accessories that are carried over from the DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise. The DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual includes a dual camera that houses two lenses – standard visual (zoom) and FLIR (Forward Looking Infra-Red) – speaker, floodlight, and beacon. The drone itself features the standard DJI Mavic style fold-out arms which provide a quicker setup time and deployment, within minutes if the situation requires. Some examples of sectors that this drone would be used for are; SAR (Search and Rescue), Emergency Services (Police, Fire, Coastguard), Commercial, Private and Industrial Inspections (visual and thermal), Restricted Area Control, Film production, aerial photography and many more.

Mode Elements

Some of the features include the advanced obstacle avoidance system reduces the risk of accidental contact with other objects improving the safety of each flight, Data Security, GPS timestamping, DJI AirSense, Ocusync 2.0 to name a few. A great feature that DJI has put some thought into is the inclusion of a Discreet Mode, this allows you to turn off the LEDs when performing a night mission to ensure you are not being obtrusive to anyone during your flight.

Perfect for Easy transport

The DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual blazes the trail for Commercial Drone Businesses wanting to access multiple sectors. In the ever-growing drone market, trying to choose the right drone for your business can almost certainly leave you confused, lost and drowning in a mass of information. This drone may be small when compared to others on the market, but don’t let that put you off as this little terrier of the sky has a bite bigger than its bark! Being a smaller drone though does have its advantages: compact and easy to store therefore saving space, easily carried/transported to remote areas without the use of vehicles, fit and access small spaces and tight spots, can be operated from small take-off/landing areas.

Powerful and Portable thermal Imaging

Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual Drone features a three-axis gimbal stabilized camera housing a side-by-side 4K sensor for capturing visible light and a FLIR imaging sensor for capturing thermal data. Together these sensors allow pilots to perform flights at night, as well as fly in complex daytime conditions like fog and smoke. Users can select from multiple intelligent display modes in the DJI Pilot flight control app to visualize data from the dual-sensor camera: FLIR MSX – A new feature that combines data from the visual and thermal cameras in real time to enhance visual details, helping pilots quickly identify and interpret critical data that may not be immediately visible to the naked eye. This Drone has features like Spot Meter – Displays the average temperature of an object, helping pilots monitor and measure critical or hazardous objects while maintaining a safe distance. Area Measurement – Displays the average, lowest, and highest temperature, as well as the corresponding locations of each area, allowing inspectors to quickly assess objects and determine if an asset may be overheating. Isotherm – Allows pilots to designate specific temperature ranges to be displayed using a custom color palette so objects within the range relay higher contrast and better visibility. This feature includes custom profiles to aid search and rescue pilots in identifying people and to help firefighters identify hot spots in fires, as well as a custom profile setting for added flexibility.

Refined Imaging And Enhanced Vision

The imaging system has been developed with two goals in mind; assisting pilots in close-range missions; and ensuring captured data is more relevant and trusted than ever. DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual Edition Drone is launched with a purpose of enhanced image visibility on all your captured data, Isotherm helps you get accurate heat measurements on a variety of objects and scenarios. You can Visualize scenarios in real time, monitor and measure objects on site more safely and efficiently so you can make the most informed decisions. Enhance image visibility for on-the ground team missions, Enhance image visibility for improved situational awareness and Create predefined isotherm setting.

Safety Features

DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual Edition Drone comes with Shield Basic properties that include: User/Pilot Error, Signal Interference, Collision, Water Damage and Drop Damage.

Emergency response

The DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual Edition Drone has the ability to go from packed away to in the air in mere minutes during emergency situations, making response times more effective. Using the Mavic 2 Enterprise is a cost-effective alternative to traditional helicopters and can help respond tactically to unexpected missions. Collect the necessary situational data to help minimize unforeseen dangers to crew and their surroundings, allowing for a safer mission.

DJI Smart Controller

The Mavic Duals smart controller was built for aircrafts with OcuSync 2.0 and made to enhance your outdoor flying experience with its ultra-bright 5.5-inch 1080p display. Allowing for clear visibility and brighter images even in less than desirable conditions like direct sunlight. It boasts intuitive controls and pre-installed apps like SkyTalk and DJI Go helping you get in the air more quickly than ever before. Third-party apps are also supported, so drone pilots have a complete choice when it comes to operational controls. The smart controller lets you connect to a HDMI port and microSD card slot, and operates at 1000 cd/m2 brightness.

Standard Remote Controller

The Mavic dual’s standard remote controller boasts 135 minutes of battery life when fully charged - leaving you plenty of time to capture what you need in the field. It is also built with an ergonomic design that allows for easy storage with its foldable body and detachable sticks. This design works exceptionally well with smartphones and gives an enhanced operational experience to use the DJI Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual Edition Drone.

Broadcast warnings or directions using the easily mounted loudspeaker. Record at night with Snap-on flood lamps. Observe suspects or track escapees. Dynamic Zoom

full_description:
DJI Avata Fly Smart Combo with FPV Goggles V2

The DJI Avata Fly Smart Drone Combo allows you to capture stable, ultra-wide 4K stabilized footage indoors or outdoors, in and around obstacles. The Avata has a "cinewhoop" design and a palm-sized form factor, with all four propellers covered by connected guards. This enables close-up filming indoors, near people, and via small apertures without endangering people or property. If the Avata does come into touch, it may just bounce off and continue flying. With the Fly Smart Combo, piloting the DJI Avata is an immersive and intuitive experience with the included FPV Goggles V2 and Motion Controller. The FPV Goggles V2 are equipped with two built-in 2" screens, each sporting a resolution of 1440 x 810 for an 810p live feed from Avata's point of view. The Motion Controller delivers a unique and natural method of flying, where instead of a typical gamepad-style remote, you squeeze a trigger to fly forward and swivel your wrist to turn corners.

Wide-Angle Stabilized Video

The DJI Avata Fly Smart Drone Combo has a 48MP 1/1.7" CMOS sensor that supports up to 4K video at 100 fps. The footage is stabilized in two ways: RockSteady 2.0 EIS and HorizonSteady EIS. RockSteady EIS works to reduce camera shake, while HorizonSteady locks the Avata's footage to a level horizon.

DJI FPV Goggles V2

The Avata's ultra-wide 155° FOV offers first-person piloting with the DJI FPV Goggles V2 a thrilling experience. The goggles get a constant transmission from the DJI O3+ system through dual-band Wi-Fi 5 (802.11ac) and may run for up to 110 minutes per charge. The live video you see is meant to be vivid and seamless owing to twin built-in 2" displays, each having a resolution of 1440 x 810 and a fast 144 Hz refresh rate.

O3+ Transmission

Using 2T2R omnidirectional antennas, the Avata can provide video with a 30 ms latency and a data transmission rate of 50 Mb/s to the FPV Goggles V2. When storing movies, the film is compressed with H.265 to reduce storage space, and it may be transferred from up to 6.2 miles away.

Obstacle Sensing & Turtle Mode

During the flight, a downward binocular vision sensor and a ToF depth sensor collaborate to identify obstructions on the ground. This enables pilots to safely fly low-altitude and interior missions. The propeller guards typically allow the Avata to endure a bump and keep flying, but what if the Avata hits hard enough to plummet and rest on its back like a turtle? Simply engage Turtle Mode with a few clicks to have the Avata flip itself right side up and resume flight.

Drone Safety

If you suspect an approaching collision, you can immediately use the emergency brake button to bring the Avata to a complete stop and hover in place. RTH (Return to Home) is another safety function that automatically returns the drone to its starting position if the battery runs out or the communication to the remote is lost.

Virtual Flight App

This app, which is designed for Windows, iOS 12.0+, and Android 9.0+, allows beginners and expert pilots to practice flying inside and outdoors, sharpening their abilities from a choice of preconfigured simulated settings. The DJI Avata Fly Smart Drone Combo with FPV Goggles V2 has no warranty.

DJI Avata Pro-View Combo Drone

The DJI Avata Pro-View Combo Drone is a high-end drone that allows you to fly in 3D and shoot spectacular aerial footage. It has a 4K/60fps camera with a 155° super-wide field of view, a strong video stabilization technology for smooth and stable recording, and a lightweight and portable design weighing about 410 g. The drone also has intuitive motion control, allowing you to operate it with natural hand motions. The drone also includes a propeller guard, which improves safety and decreases noise. The DJI Avata Pro-View Combo Drone includes a set of FPV goggles that deliver high-quality video transmission from the drone at 1080p/100fps with a latency of 30 ms. In addition, the goggles contain twin 1080p micro-OLED displays that provide a sharp and colorful perspective of the flight. The goggles also contain a head tracking capability that allows you to adjust the angle of the camera by moving your head.

RC Motion 2

Using motion-sensing hand motions and an inbuilt joystick, the single-handed controller allows even new pilots to effortlessly operate the DJI Avata Pro-View Combo Drone. The accelerator trigger drives the Avata forward while also allowing you to fly in reverse if necessary. The integrated FN dial, similar to piloting, allows you to alter Avata camera settings remotely. Your actions are meant to mirror what you see in the Integra goggles for an exciting and fluid experience, with dual-band 2.4/5.8 GHz transmission from up to 6.2 miles away.

Obstacle Sensing

In order to detect obstacles on the ground, a ToF depth sensor and a downward binocular vision sensor collaborate during flight. This makes it possible for pilots to safely perform low-altitude and interior missions.

Turtle Mode

If an DJI Avata Pro-View Combo Drone hits too hard, it may tumble and rest on its back like a turtle. Normally, the propeller protectors let it to survive bumps and continue flying. The Avata will turn itself over and resume flying as soon as you switch to Turtle Mode. This app, designed for Windows, iOS 12.0+, and Android 9.0+, allows beginners and expert pilots to practice flying inside and outdoors, sharpening their abilities from a range of preconfigured simulated settings.

Wide-Angle Stabilized Video

The DJI Avata Pro-View Combo Drone has a 48MP 1/1.7" CMOS sensor that can record 4K video at 100 frames per second. For a genuine and authentic experience, this movie was taken with an ultra-wide 155° FOV that matches how we view with our own eyes. RockSteady 2.0 EIS and HorizonSteady EIS are used to stabilize the video in two ways. HorizonSteady locks the Avata's video to a level horizon, while RockSteady EIS attempts to eliminate camera motion.

DJI Avata 2 Fly More Combo Drone with Goggles 3 & RC Motion 3 Controller

The DJI Avata 2 Fly More Combo Drone provides an immersive FPV drone experience while improving imaging, safety, and battery life. It's combination of the Avata 2 with the brand-new DJI RC Motion 3 comtroller and Goggles 3, the fun factor increases. It takes incredibly clear pictures and movies thanks to its 12-megapixel 1/1.3-inch image sensor and wide-angle lens, which has a 155 degree field of view and an f/2.8 aperture. The manual and auto settings guarantee the best performance in different lighting conditions, with an ISO range of 100 to 25600. Up to 4K video resolutions at 60 frames per second provide remarkable clarity and are backed by stabilization technologies such as HorizonSteady and RockSteady 3.0+. With a mechanical range of -95 to 90 degrees tilt and real-time screen correction, the gimbal system offers accurate control. Precise hovering and obstacle avoidance are made possible by the sensing technologies of the DJI Avata 2 Fly More Combo Drone. Transmission systems can transmit live images in up to 1080p at 100 frames per second over a distance of up to 13 kilometers. Extended flight durations of up to 23 minutes are guaranteed by intelligent flight battery technology, and the aircraft's lightweight construction and compact dimensions allow for excellent maneuverability.

DJI Goggles 3

For simple control over body movement, the DJI Goggles 3 can be utilized in conjunction with the DJI RC Motion 3 controller and the DJI Avata 2 drone. All you need to do to pilot the Avata 2 drone and experience an engrossing and visually stimulating flight through the skies is to tilt your head or wrist. With its new Real View PiP technology and DJI O4 low-latency video transmission, the Goggles 3 provides dependable safety and stability for your flights. With DJI's latest O4 digital video transmission technology, which has a 2-transmitter, 4-receiver, and 6-antenna design, the DJI Goggles 3 has strong anti-interference capabilities. The drone system automatically switches between the 2.4 GHz and 5.8 GHz bands based on signal conditions to maintain steady, near-synchronous flight sensations. It also has a transmission latency as low as 24 ms and a range of up to 13 km.

DJI RC Motion 3

With just the touch of a button, the DJI RC Motion 3 offers thrilling, dynamic flight maneuvers while keeping operating straightforward and user-friendly. Capturing an immersive flying experience with one hand allows you to soar effortlessly. You may control the drone's motion with your wrists when you use the DJI Avata 2 Drone with DJI Goggles 3. When paired with the strong anti-interference feature of the DJI RC Motion 3, you can accomplish accurate "point-to-fly" control capabilities. With DJI Goggles 3, the RC may be utilized to manipulate an augmented reality pointer and browse through the menu on the goggles' display. Compared to physical buttons, this method is more efficient for enabling operations, modifying transmission specs, and tweaking camera settings.

1/1.3-inch CMOS Sensor

The DJI Avata 2 drone features an advanced 1/1.3-inch CMOS sensor that increases the filmed dynamic range and handles low-light conditions more effectively, resulting in amazing footage on every flight. Realize your full aerial potential. The amazing sensation of fast-moving objects is captured by the Avata 2's 4K/60fps HDR. For more precisely calibrated videos, you can change the noise reduction and sharpness settings in the goggles. Avata 2's improved stabilization technology, which DJI developed, allows it to record steady, smooth footage even in windy or fast-moving situations.

Tight Shots in Super-Wide 4K

With the DJI Avata 2 drone's 155° field of view and its ability to move quickly toward and away from targets, you can create amazing images. Experienced drone operators can effortlessly execute aerobatic maneuvers and snap swift, dramatic, low-altitude images beyond the reach of other drones.

155° Ultra-Wide-Angle FOV

The DJI Avata 2 Drone's 4K/60fps HDR captures the amazing sensation of fast flying. You may fine-tune the videos using the goggles by adjusting the noise reduction and sharpness levels. Further simplify color grading while capturing excellent richness in highlights and shadows and improving post-production opportunities for content.

Automatic Return to Home (RTH) Function

The DJI Avata 2 drone can now navigate freely in confined spaces thanks to its revised integrated propeller guard design, making it lighter and more nimble. You can deal with unforeseen circumstances composedly by bringing the drone to a stop by releasing the accelerator on RC Motion 3 or hitting the lock button. Moreover, an additional degree of protection is added by the automatic Return to Home (RTH) feature, which kicks in when the drone's battery runs low or there is a communication outage.

Advanced Positioning With New Sensors

In low-altitude and indoor flights, new binocular fisheye sensors allow for downward and backward optical positioning, improving flight stability and safety. The Avata 2 drone and LightCut may be remotely connected. This allows you to edit and view the recorded video without having to download it, freeing up valuable smartphone storage.

Turtle Mode

When in Turtle mode, the DJI Avata 2 Drone may swiftly return to flight by automatically flipping itself back into takeoff position when it is upside down. With flawless camera work and superb framing, you can easily filter through and choose highlights with AI's clever understanding of video kinds and themes. along with an extensive selection of themed themes, allowing you to create professional-looking material. Among its many features are intelligent sound effects, color recovery, the ability to apply device watermarks with only one click, and end credits.

Type-C PD Fast Charging

With a maximum flying duration of 23 minutes and support for PD rapid charging, the DJI Avata 2 Drone can be swiftly recharged and back in the air in no time. With the power accumulation function of the new DJI Avata 2 Two-Way Charging Hub, you may have a "extra battery" for those crucial moments by transferring residual power from numerous batteries to the one with the highest charge level.

O4 Video Transmission

You can fully immerse yourself in every flight with the DJI Avata 2 Fly More Combo Drone because to its better stability in DJI O4 video transmission, which also increases safety. Strong anti-interference performance is ensured by its two-transmitter, four-receiver, four-antenna architecture. It also offers a maximum video transmission distance of 13 km, a transmission latency as low as 24 ms, high-definition image quality of 1080p/100fps, and a maximum transmission bitrate of 60Mbps.

46GB Internal Storage

With 46GB of onboard storage, the DJI Avata 2 Drone can save about 90 minutes of 1080p/60 frames per second video, allowing you to record and save the best moments from every flight. Using Wi-Fi to quickly upload files to your phone makes post-editing and sharing your completed work quite effective.

Virtual Flight App

The latest version of Virtual Flight provides an exclusive first look at one-tap stunts and the excitement of first-person virtual reality flying. Explore brand-new missions and settings, and get fully immersed in DJI Avata 2 Drone's control system.

full_description:
DJI Avata Fly Smart Drone Combo & FPV Goggles V2 with Avata Fly More Kit

The DJI Avata Fly Smart Drone Combo allows you to capture stable, ultra-wide 4K stabilized footage indoors or outdoors, in and around obstacles. The Avata has a "cinewhoop" design and a palm-sized form factor, with all four propellers covered by connected guards. This enables close-up filming indoors, near people, and via small apertures without endangering people or property. If the Avata does come into touch, it may just bounce off and continue flying. With the Fly Smart Combo, piloting the DJI Avata is an immersive and intuitive experience with the included FPV Goggles V2 and Motion Controller. The FPV Goggles V2 are equipped with two built-in 2" screens, each sporting a resolution of 1440 x 810 for an 810p live feed from Avata's point of view. The Motion Controller delivers a unique and natural method of flying, where instead of a typical gamepad-style remote, you squeeze a trigger to fly forward and swivel your wrist to turn corners.

Wide-Angle Stabilized Video

The DJI Avata Fly Smart Drone Combo has a 48MP 1/1.7" CMOS sensor that supports up to 4K video at 100 fps. The footage is stabilized in two ways: RockSteady 2.0 EIS and HorizonSteady EIS. RockSteady EIS works to reduce camera shake, while HorizonSteady locks the Avata's footage to a level horizon.

DJI FPV Goggles V2

The Avata's ultra-wide 155° FOV offers first-person piloting with the DJI FPV Goggles V2 a thrilling experience. The goggles get a constant transmission from the DJI O3+ system through dual-band Wi-Fi 5 (802.11ac) and may run for up to 110 minutes per charge. The live video you see is meant to be vivid and seamless owing to twin built-in 2" displays, each having a resolution of 1440 x 810 and a fast 144 Hz refresh rate.

O3+ Transmission

Using 2T2R omnidirectional antennas, the Avata can provide video with a 30 ms latency and a data transmission rate of 50 Mb/s to the FPV Goggles V2. When storing movies, the film is compressed with H.265 to reduce storage space, and it may be transferred from up to 6.2 miles away.

Obstacle Sensing & Turtle Mode

During the flight, a downward binocular vision sensor and a ToF depth sensor collaborate to identify obstructions on the ground. This enables pilots to safely fly low-altitude and interior missions. The propeller guards typically allow the Avata to endure a bump and keep flying, but what if the Avata hits hard enough to plummet and rest on its back like a turtle? Simply engage Turtle Mode with a few clicks to have the Avata flip itself right side up and resume flight.

Drone Safety

If you suspect an approaching collision, you can immediately use the emergency brake button to bring the Avata to a complete stop and hover in place. RTH (Return to Home) is another safety function that automatically returns the drone to its starting position if the battery runs out or the communication to the remote is lost.

Virtual Flight App

This app, which is designed for Windows, iOS 12.0+, and Android 9.0+, allows beginners and expert pilots to practice flying inside and outdoors, sharpening their abilities from a choice of preconfigured simulated settings. 

Avata Fly More Kit

The DJI Avata Fly More Kit comes with two Intelligent Flight Batteries and a charging station, ensuring that you have ample power for your flights. The Intelligent Flight Battery has a rated capacity of 35.71 Wh and an estimated battery life of 18 minutes. DJI Intelligent Battery Management analyzes power status in real-time, allowing you to focus on a flight rather than a battery level. The DJI Avata Battery Charging Station can charge four batteries simultaneously, significantly enhancing charging efficiency. The DJI Avata Fly Smart Drone Combo with FPV Goggles V2 has no warranty.

full_description:
DJI Air 3 Fly More Combo With DJI RC 2 Remote Controller

The DJI Air 3 Drone Combo With DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller is a strong and flexible drone that provides breathtaking and smooth aerial photography. The drone has two cameras, one wide-angle and one medium-telephoto, both with 1/1.3-inch CMOS sensors and 48 megapixels. The drone can record 4K movies at 60 frames per second with HDR or 4K films at 100 frames per second for slow motion effects. The drone also supports D-Log M and HLG color profiles, which provide post-processing versatility and creativity. The drone weighs 720 grams and has a maximum flying duration of 46 minutes. The drone also includes omnidirectional obstacle detection, which allows it to identify and avoid obstacles in all directions. The drone comes with the DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller, which includes a DJI O4 transmission technology that can send a 1080p/60fps video feed up to 20km away. The remote controller also has a maximum takeoff height of 6km, allowing you to explore higher and further. The DJI Air 3 Fly More Combo With DJI RC 2 Remote Controller is an excellent alternative for consumers looking for a high-performance and dependable drone for photography and filming.

Aircraft Performance and Capabilities

The DJI Air 3 Drone has a sleek and compact design with folding arms and propellers for simple transport and storage. It weighs only 720 g, but because of its large battery, it can fly for up to 46 minutes on a single charge. It can also attain a high speed of 21 meters per second (19 meters per second in EU countries) and a maximum altitude of 6000 meters, providing you with lots of range and versatility. The drone features an omnidirectional binocular vision system with an infrared sensor at the bottom that can detect and avoid objects in all directions. It also has a worldwide navigation satellite system (GPS + Galileo + BeiDou) for precise location and hovering. The drone features 8 GB of onboard storage and accepts microSD cards up to 512 GB for additional storage.

Camera Features and Specifications

The DJI Air 3 Drone has a dual-camera system with a wide-angle and a medium-tele camera, both having 1/1.3-inch CMOS sensors and 48 MP effective pixels. The camera has an 82° field of view, a format equivalent of 24 mm, an aperture of f/1.7, and a focus range of 1 m. The 35° FOV camera has a format equivalent to 70 mm, an aperture of f/2.8, and a focus range of 3 m. The dual-camera system lets you take images and films from various viewpoints and zoom settings. With the remote controller or the app, you can effortlessly switch between the two cameras. You may also utilize digital zoom to come closer to your topic without sacrificing quality. The wide-angle camera has a zoom range of 1-3x, while the medium-tele camera has a zoom range of 3–9x. The DJI Air 3 can record movies in H.264/H.265 codecs at resolutions up to 4K at 100 frames per second (only H.265). Depending on your preferences and editing needs, you may also select alternative color modes and sampling techniques, such as Normal, HLG, or D-Log M. Vertical shooting options for social media sites are also supported by the drone. The DJI Air 3 can shoot JPEG/DNG (RAW) photographs with resolutions up to 80646048 pixels. You may also select between other still photography modes, such as Single Shot, Burst Shooting, Automatic Exposure Bracketing (AEB), and Timed Shot. The drone also has simulated long exposure modes that may be used to capture light trails or water flows.

Gimbal Stabilization and Control

A 3-axis mechanical gimbal stabilizes the camera and delivers flawless footage on the DJI Air 3 Drone . The mechanical range of the gimbal is -135° to 70° (tilt), -50° to 50° (roll), and -27° to 27° (pan), while the controlled range is -90° to 60° (tilt) and -5° to 5° (pan). The gimbal has a maximum control speed of 100 degrees per second (tilt) and an angular vibration range of 0.0037 degrees.

Video Transmission

The DJI Air 3 Drone has the O4 video transmission system, which sends high-quality live view photos from the drone to your mobile device or remote controller. The video transmission system uses three frequency bands: 2.4 GHz, 5.1 GHz, and 5.8 GHz, and it can transition between them automatically to minimize interference. The video transmission system may give live view quality up to 1080p at 60 frames per second, with a maximum download speed of 10 MB/s (when using the DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller or the DJI RC 2) or Wi-Fi at 5:30 MB/s (when using compatible mobile devices). In addition, the video transmission system may achieve a low latency of around 120 ms (depending on the real environment and mobile device). The video transmission system may enable a maximum transmission distance of up to 20 km (FCC), depending on the real environment and interference level. To deliver a solid and dependable signal, the video transmission system employs six antennas in a 2T4R configuration.

DJI RC 2 Remote Controller

The DJI RC 2 Remote Controller is a remote controller that allows you to control your DJI drone in a simple and straightforward manner. The remote controller has a 5.5-inch 1080p FHD screen that displays the drone's video feed clearly and brightly. The screen offers a brightness of 700 nits, making it easy to view even in direct sunlight. The remote controller now includes DJI O4 video transmission, which provides better anti-interference capabilities and crystal-clear, low-latency video transmission over a maximum range of 20 kilometers. A 2T4R antenna on the remote controller ensures stable and consistent communication. The remote controller's battery life is impressive, lasting up to 3 hours of continuous operation. The remote control also offers live streaming.

full_description:
DJI Mavic 3 Classic Combo Drone

The DJI Mavic 3 Classic Combo Drone is a small and portable drone that can take high-quality aerial photos and videos. The drone is equipped with a Hasselblad camera with a 4/3 CMOS sensor capable of recording up to 5.1K video and 20 MP images, as well as a 3x digital zoom function. The drone also incorporates an omnidirectional vision system for obstacle detection and avoidance in all directions, as well as a bottom-mounted infrared sensor for precision landing. The drone boasts a folding design that makes it easy to transport and store, as well as an IP55-rated casing that keeps dust and water out. The drone includes a dual-battery system with hot-swapping and self-heating capabilities. With the O3+ video transmission technology, the drone can fly for up to 46 minutes on a single battery and has a maximum transmission distance of 15 kilometers. The DJI Mavic 3 Classic Combo Drone features 8 GB of in-built storage and can accept microSD cards up to 512 GB in size. The drone has a strong propulsion system that allows it to fly at speeds of up to 21 meters per second and withstand gusts of up to 12 meters per second. The drone also has a GNSS module that supports GPS, Galileo, and BeiDou satellites for improved positioning. The drone can save satellite observation data for post-processed kinematics (PPK), which may be used with the DJI Terra software to build high-precision maps and models. When the GNSS signal is lost or weak, the RTK-aided inertial navigation system (RAINS) maintains high-precision positioning.

Hasselblad Camera with Digital Zoom

The Hasselblad camera in the DJI Mavic 3 Classic has a 4/3 CMOS sensor and produces stunning picture quality and dynamic range. The camera can capture 5.1K video at 30 frames per second or 4K video at 120 frames per second, as well as 20 MP photographs in JPEG or RAW format. In addition, the camera supports H.264/H.265 codecs for optimal storage and editing. The camera features a 24 mm equivalent lens, an aperture range of f/2.8-f/11, and a focus range of 1 m to infinity. The camera also includes a 3x digital zoom mode, allowing you to go closer to your subject without sacrificing image quality.

Omnidirectional Obstacle Sensing and Avoidance

The DJI Mavic 3 Classic has an omnidirectional vision technology that detects and avoids obstacles in all directions, assuring safe and smooth flying. Six pairs of cameras are situated on the front, rear, left, right, top, and bottom of the drone, as well as an infrared sensor at the bottom for accurate landing. Depending on the surroundings and speed of the drone, the system can identify impediments from 0.5 m to 200 m away. APAS (Advanced Pilot Assistance System) mode is also supported, which automatically prepares the optimal flying route to avoid obstructions.

Long Flight Time and Transmission Range

The DJI Mavic 3 Classic features a large battery that allows you up to 46 minutes of flying duration on a single charge, letting you to take more footage without interruption. The battery may also be charged quickly using the supplied charger or the optional DJI 100W USB-C Power Adapter. The drone also features an O3+ video transmission technology, which provides crisp and reliable live view quality up to 1080p at 60 frames per second. The system can transmit data at 2.4 GHz and 5.8 GHz frequencies and has a maximum transmission distance of 15 km in an unobstructed and interference-free environment. Wi-Fi 6 is also supported for quicker data transfer.

Intelligent Flight Battery

The DJI Mavic 3 Classic Combo Drone takes advantage of the DJI Mavic 3 Intelligent flying Battery, a high-capacity Li-ion 4S battery that gives the drone up to 46 minutes of flying duration. The battery contains 5000 mAh of capacity, 15.4 V of nominal voltage, and 77 Wh of energy. Intelligent functions such as self-discharge prevention, overcharge and discharge protection, low-temperature protection, and balancing charging are also supported by the battery. The supplied power adapter, the optional DJI 100W USB-C Power Adapter, or the optional vehicle charger may all be used to charge the battery. The battery is also compatible with the optional battery charging hub, which can charge up to three batteries simultaneously. The battery contains four LED indicators that reflect the battery's remaining power level and status.

DJI Mavic 3 Pro Fly More Combo 4K Drone with Remote Controller

The DJI Mavic 3 Pro Fly More Combo Drone with Remote Controller is equipped with a Hasselblad camera with a 4/3 CMOS sensor capable of recording up to 5.1K video and 20 MP images, as well as two additional cameras for medium and tele zoom. The drone also incorporates an omnidirectional binocular vision system for obstacle detection and avoidance in all directions, as well as a bottom-mounted infrared sensor for precision landing. With the O3+ video transmission technology, the DJI Mavic 3 Pro Fly More Combo Drone can fly for up to 43 minutes on a single battery and has a maximum transmission distance of 15 kilometers.

Hasselblad Camera with Three Lenses

It features a Hasselblad camera with a 4/3 CMOS sensor, which produces amazing image quality and dynamic range. The camera can capture 5.1K video at 30 frames per second or 4K video at 120 frames per second, as well as 20 MP photographs in JPEG or RAW format. For professional editing, the camera also supports Apple ProRes 422 HQ/422/422 LT codecs. The DJI Mavic 3 Pro Fly More Combo Drone also includes two additional cameras for medium and telephoto zoom, giving a total optical zoom range of 1-28x. The medium tele camera has a 1/1.3′′ CMOS sensor and a lens equivalent to 70mm, whilst the tele camera has a 1/2′′ CMOS sensor and a lens comparable to 166mm. The three cameras collaborate to deliver smooth zooming and change between focus lengths.

Omnidirectional Obstacle Sensing and Avoidance

The DJI Mavic 3 Pro has an omnidirectional binocular vision technology that detects and avoids obstacles in all directions, assuring safe and smooth flying. Six pairs of cameras are situated on the front, rear, left, right, top, and bottom of the drone, as well as an infrared sensor at the bottom for accurate landing. Depending on the surroundings and speed of the drone, the system can identify impediments from 0.5 m to 200 m away. APAS (Advanced Pilot Assistance System) mode is also supported, which automatically prepares the optimal flying route to avoid obstructions.

Long Flight Time and Transmission Range

The DJI Mavic 3 Pro offers a large battery that can give up to 43 minutes of flying duration on a single charge, letting you take more footage without interruption. The battery may also be charged quickly using the supplied charger or the optional DJI 100W USB-C Power Adapter. The drone also features an O3+ video transmission technology, which provides crisp and reliable live view quality up to 1080p at 60 frames per second. The system can transmit data at 2.4 GHz and 5.8 GHz frequencies and has a maximum transmission distance of 15 km in an unobstructed and interference-free environment. Wi-Fi 6 is also supported for quicker data transfer.

Intelligent Flight Battery

The DJI Mavic 3 pro Intelligent Flying Battery is a high-performance Li-ion 4S battery with a flying duration of up to 43 minutes. The battery contains 5000 mAh of capacity, 15.4 V of nominal voltage, and 77 Wh of energy. Intelligent functions such as self-discharge prevention, overcharge and discharge protection, low-temperature protection, and balancing charging are also supported by the battery. The supplied power adapter, the optional DJI 100W USB-C Power Adapter, or the optional vehicle charger may all be used to charge the battery. The battery is also compatible with the optional battery charging hub, which can charge up to three batteries simultaneously. The battery contains four LED indicators that reflect the battery's remaining power level and status.

Dynamic by Default

All in the Details

Optimized Capture

Scene recognition optimizes different camera parameters for various scenes and supports intelligent recognition of five categories: sunset, skies, grass, snow, and trees. In strong lighting conditions, HDR significantly improves the dynamic range, adjusting exposure parameters and layering shots for more vibrant, high-quality photos. HyperLight optimizes photos taken in low-light conditions, resulting in less noise and enhanced clarity.

See the Whole Picture

Capture Cinematic Shots

Master the Skies

Fly freely while the camera remains locked on the subject with this convenient mode. Simply select your subject and fly. Following subjects while avoiding obstacles is smoother than ever with the latest version of DJIâ€™s ActiveTrack technology. With better pathfinding and a faster and more accurate prediction of lost subjects, this technology keeps your subject in the center of the frame, even if they move behind a tree. POI 3.0 improves the capabilities of POI 2.0, especially the recognition of flat surfaces. Where POI 2.0 might lose the target while tracking, this improved feature does not. Time and Movement

Reliable Signal, Smooth Flight

Fly Longer

Effortless Editing

Designed for Pilots

The remote controller also links to your smartphone through the DJI Fly app, allowing you to watch the camera's live feed, change settings, and access advanced functions. The package also includes a set of FPV goggles that transmit low-latency, high-resolution video from the drone, giving you a first-person view of the flight. The goggles also contain a head tracking capability that allows you to adjust the angle of the camera by moving your head.

RC Motion 2

DJI Avata Explorer Combo FPV Drones single-handed controller allows even inexperienced pilots to handle the Avata easily using motion-sensing hand movements and an integrated joystick. The accelerator trigger propels the Avata ahead, but it also allows you to fly in backward if necessary. In similar to piloting, the integrated FN dial allows you to change Avata camera settings remotely. With dual-band 2.4/5.8 GHz transmission from up to 6.2 miles away, your motions are designed to match what you see in the Integra goggles for a thrilling and fluid experience.

Obstacle Sensing

During flight, a downward binocular vision sensor and a ToF depth sensor work together to identify obstructions on the ground. This enables pilots to fly low-altitude and interior missions safely.

Turtle Mode

The propeller guards normally allow the DJI Avata Explorer Combo FPV Drone to endure a bump and continue flying, but what if the Avata hits so hard that it falls and lands on its back like a turtle? Just engage Turtle Mode and the Avata will flip itself right-side up and resume flight.

Virtual Flight App

This app, designed for Windows, iOS 12.0+, and Android 9.0+, allows beginners and expert pilots to practice flying inside and outdoors, sharpening their abilities from a range of preconfigured simulated settings.

Wide-Angle Stabilized Video

The DJI Avata Explorer Combo FPV Drone has a 48MP 1/1.7" CMOS sensor that can record 4K video at 100 frames per second. For a genuine and authentic experience, this movie was taken with an ultra-wide 155° FOV that matches how we view with our own eyes. RockSteady 2.0 EIS and HorizonSteady EIS are used to stabilize the video in two ways. HorizonSteady locks the Avata's video to a level horizon, while RockSteady EIS attempts to eliminate camera motion.

DJI Air 2S All-in-One Drone Quadcopter Combo

The DJI Air 2S All-in-One Drone Quadcopter combo comes with a 1-inch CMOS sensor, powerful autonomous functions, and a compact body weighing less than 600 g, DJI Air 2S is the ultimate drone for creators on the move. Take this all-in-one aerial powerhouse along anywhere to experience and record your world in stunning detail. Equipped with a 1-inch image sensor and large 2.4Î¼m pixels, DJI Air 2S is capable of 5.4K/30fps and 4K/60fps video. Capture any moment with the rich clarity and authentic color tones it deserves. You can capture the allure of the world, even as it darkens. Thanks to a high dynamic range, high resolution, and accurate color reproduction, even low-light scenes are sharp and vibrant. One billion colors captured by the 10-bit Dlog-M color profile of DJI Air 2S let you fully immerse yourself in all the hues of your environment. You can shoot RAW format photos with a dynamic range of up to 12.6 stops to capture more visual information in every scene, even when lighting conditions are bad or complex. This provides more flexibility in post-processing, giving creators more possibilities to get the look they want. The Intelligent HDR technology merges multiple shots automatically, increasing the dynamic range of images without the need for post-processing. That means more nuanced details in both the highlights and shadows for richer images with greater depth. The DJI Air 2S features Hyperlapse and Panorama. Speed up time and movement with a single tap by creating a striking hyperlapse. You can also capture larger, more detailed shots of your surroundings with panorama. MasterShots and FocusTrack effortlessly turn any adventure into cinematic footage. The next evolution of QuickShots, MasterShots is an advanced intelligent feature that gives users the best shots in any location with just a tap. Simply select your subject, and the drone will film while executing ten different maneuvers in sequence, keeping your subject center-frame and generating a short cinematic video afterward. FocusTrack features Spotlight 2.0, ActiveTrack 4.0, and Point of Interest 3.0, making it a breeze for DJI Air 2S to follow or circle your subject. DJI Air 2S has the ability to perceive its environment in four directions: up, down, forward, and backward. The algorithms for Advanced Pilot Assistance Systems (APAS 4.0) have been further improved, allowing DJI Air 2S to actively avoid obstacles in more complex scenarios and at high speeds. DJI Air 2S features DJI's most advanced O3 (OcuSync 3.0) image transmission technology, delivering an ultra-smooth, clear, and reliable image feed. DJI Air 2S provides an added layer of airspace safety with the industry-leading AirSense safety system. This receives Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast (ADS-B) flight location information from airplanes and helicopters in your area that transmit ADS-B signals, displays those aircraft on a map, and provides audio and visual alerts through the DJI Fly app to help you keep the drone out of the way of those aircraft. The combination of portability, safety, and intelligent technology means you can spend more time enjoying flights and less time worrying about them. Take DJI Air 2S into the sky confidently, every flight. DJI Air 2S All-in-One Drone Quadcopter has No Warranty.

full_description:
DJI Air 3 Drone 

The DJI Air 3 Drone is a drone capable of taking stunning images and movies thanks to its dual-camera system, which allows you to choose between different views and magnification capabilities. It contains a 3-axis mechanical gimbal to steady the camera and provide smooth filming, as well as an O4 video transmission technology to send high-quality live view photos from the drone to your mobile device or remote controller. With its omnidirectional binocular vision system, it can fly for up to 46 minutes on a single charge, achieve a peak speed of 21 m/s, and avoid obstacles in any direction. It also includes the DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller, a new and enhanced version of the DJI RC 2, with an integrated screen that shows essential flight information and a dedicated switch for switching between the wide-angle and medium-tele cameras. The DJI Air 3 is a strong and adaptable drone that can accommodate a wide range of requirements and preferences.

Aircraft Performance and Capabilities

The DJI Air 3 Drone has a sleek and compact design with folding arms and propellers for simple transport and storage. It weighs only 720 g, but because to its large battery, it can fly for up to 46 minutes on a single charge. It can also attain a high speed of 21 meters per second (19 meters per second in EU countries) and a maximum altitude of 6000 meters, providing you lots of range and versatility. The drone features an omnidirectional binocular vision system with an infrared sensor at the bottom that can detect and avoid objects in all directions. It also has a worldwide navigation satellite system (GPS + Galileo + BeiDou) for precise location and hovering. The drone features 8 GB of onboard storage and accepts microSD cards up to 512 GB for additional storage.

Camera Features and Specifications

The DJI Air 3 Drone has a dual-camera system with a wide-angle and a medium tele camera, both having 1/1.3-inch CMOS sensors and 48 MP effective pixels. The camera has an 82° field of view, a format equivalent of 24 mm, an aperture of f/1.7, and a focus range of 1 m to. The 35° FOV camera has a format equivalent to 70 mm, an aperture of f/2.8, and a focus range of 3 m to. The dual-camera system lets you take images and films from various viewpoints and zoom settings. With the remote controller or the app, you can effortlessly switch between the two cameras. You may also utilize digital zoom to come closer to your topic without sacrificing quality. The wide-angle camera has a zoom range of 1-3x, while the medium tele camera has a zoom range of 3-9x. The DJI Air 3 can record movies in H.264/H.265 codecs at resolutions up to 4K at 100 frames per second (only H.265). Depending on your preferences and editing needs, you may also select alternative color modes and sampling techniques, such as Normal, HLG, or D-Log M. Vertical shooting options for social media sites are also supported by the drone. The DJI Air 3 can shoot JPEG/DNG (RAW) photographs with resolutions up to 80646048 pixels. You may also select between other still photography modes, such as Single Shot, Burst Shooting, Automatic Exposure Bracketing (AEB), and Timed Shot. The drone also has simulated long exposure modes that may be used to capture light trails or water flows.

Gimbal Stabilization and Control

A 3-axis mechanical gimbal stabilizes the camera and delivers flawless footage on the DJI Air 3 Drone . The mechanical range of the gimbal is -135° to 70° (tilt), -50° to 50° (roll), and -27° to 27° (pan), while the controlled range is -90° to 60° (tilt) and -5° to 5° (pan). The gimbal has a maximum control speed of 100 degrees per second (tilt) and an angular vibration range of 0.0037 degrees.

Video Transmission

The DJI Air 3 Drone has the O4 video transmission system, which sends high-quality live view photos from the drone to your mobile device or remote controller. The video transmission system uses three frequency bands: 2.4 GHz, 5.1 GHz, and 5.8 GHz, and it can transition between them automatically to minimize interference. The video transmission system may give live view quality up to 1080p at 60 frames per second, with a maximum download speed of 10 MB/s (when using the DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller or the DJI RC 2) or Wi-Fi 5:30 MB/s (when using compatible mobile devices). In addition, the video transmission system may achieve a low latency of around 120 ms (depending on the real environment and mobile device). The video transmission system may enable a maximum transmission distance of up to 20 km (FCC), depending on the real environment and interference level. To deliver a solid and dependable signal, the video transmission system employs six antennas in a 2T4R configuration.

Remote Controller Compatibility and Connection

The DJI Air 3 Drone includes the DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller, which is an updated version of the DJI RC 2. The DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller includes an integrated screen that shows critical flight information including as battery level, signal strength, flight mode, and more. The DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller also has a dedicated switch for switching between the wide-angle and medium-tele camera modes, as well as a dial for setting the zoom level. The DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller has a maximum operational time of 6 hours without charging and 3.5 hours with a mobile device charged. The DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller is compatible with mobile devices that have Lightning, USB-C, or Micro-USB connections (using a Micro-USB port needs the DJI RC-N1 RC Cable (Standard Micro USB connector), which is offered separately). The maximum supported mobile device size of the DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller is 1808610 mm (LWH). The DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller communicates with the drone using the same video transmission mechanism, and it can send video signals to your mobile device or the built-in screen. For connecting to compatible devices, the DJI RC-N2 Remote Controller now supports Bluetooth 5.2.
